name: Synthetic Society
one_liner: Synthetic Agents to Simulate Real Users

name: Mesmer
long_description: Mesmer is Cursor for CTOs. We give founders and CTOs full visibility into their org without drowning in meetings or chasing updates. We are a team of repeat founders and CTOs with 15+ years of experience each, including leading product development togehter at Origin Financial, a fintech started by Mesmer's CEO, as it scaled to 8-figure ARR, 100+ employees and a $400M valuation. Mesmer reached 6-figure ARR within a week of launching and is already live with companies worth over $8B, including Webflow and Origin Financial.
one_liner: Cursor for CTOs

name: Nimbic AI
one_liner: Automatically write and update internal docs with every code commit.

name: Delty
long_description:
As software systems grow more complex and teams scale, key engineering work happens outside of code: product specs, docs, and architecture decisions and norms. That’s where a staff software engineer shines.

Delty is an AI staff engineer.

Like a seasoned engineer embedded in your team, Delty understands your architecture, code evolution, and constraints. It designs new software systems and grounds your coding agents with real engineering context to help you deliver reliable, scalable systems, fast.
one_liner: AI staff engineer: software architect that leads coding agents

name: StarSling
long_description: StarSling is building an agentic developer homepage that automates all the tasks that eat up a developer’s time after they’ve left their code editor: deployments, performance, incidents, and bugs. Open your homepage, click on a GitHub, Linear, or Sentry issue and you’ll see an Autofix button that triggers an AI agent and opens up a Pull Request with a fix, all without leaving your homepage.
one_liner: Cursor for DevOps

name: Godela
long_description:
What if every experiment you wanted to run could be modeled using AI? 
Godela is an AI-powered physics engine that gives engineers faster, cheaper replacement to simulations and physical prototypes.
No set up, no wait. Just ask—and get simulation quality result.
one_liner: AI Physics Engine to replace simulations and prototypes

name: Docket
long_description: Docket lets you write end-to-end tests in plain English and keeps them up to date automatically—powered by real user sessions.
one_liner: AI agents for web testing

name: TraceRoot.AI
long_description: TraceRoot.AI is the first open source AI agent that monitors production environments and automatically fixes bugs. It connects to telemetry data like traces, logs, metrics and repo to analyze and auto-resolve bugs.
one_liner: Open source AI agents automatically fix your production bugs

name: Ghostship
long_description:
We find bugs in your product with AI agents that crawl across your product and test its features. All you need to do is connect your Github and every time you create a PR, Ghostship will figure out where the bugs are before you push to production.

We're starting with web apps, but we'll eventually test any piece of software your users would interact with like a mobile app or a desktop app. Good UX is a moat today, but with Ghostship, it'll be the standard tomorrow.

Ghostship — don't get caught lacking by your users.
one_liner: Browser agents for finding UX bugs in your product

name: datafruit
long_description:
Datafruit is the first agentic DevOps engineer.

It understands your deployment standards, design docs, and DevOps practices, then reasons across them to reduce cloud waste, prevent deployment delays, and eliminate wasted time across the stack. 

Reach out to us: founders@datafruit.dev
one_liner: AI DevOps Engineer

name: Topological
long_description:
Topological is developing physics-based foundation models for CAD optimization. We help hardware teams iterate at the same speed that software teams do. Our technology is accelerating the engineering workflow with AI and scales design and optimization to identify the ideal designs for complex problems given their physical constraints with enhanced speed and performance. 

Our first model, UToP-v1, is a SOTA topology optimization model that understands physics, geometry, and manufacturability. It can generate the most efficient design given a problem’s physical requirements. It has <5% compliance error and is 1930x faster than current methods. We're reimagining mechanical engineering and computational design with precision spatial AI.
one_liner: Physics-based foundation models for CAD optimization.

name: bitrig
long_description:
Bitrig is the only vibe coder that writes native Swift, which is how the top mobile apps are coded. It's like Lovable for iPhone apps.

Kyle and Jacob are creators of SwiftUI, the framework Apple says is the "the best way to build an app," and led its development for the past 10 years. Tim was co-founder and designer of Storehouse, where he won an Apple Design Award and was later acquired by Square. 

Download bitrig from the App Store:
https://apps.apple.com/us/app/bitrig/id6747835910
one_liner: Vibe code, test, and deploy Swift apps. All from your iPhone.

name: Herdora
one_liner: Cursor for CUDA

name: Panels
long_description: Panels is an audio data platform that delivers large-scale, richly labeled speech datasets from vetted, diverse contributors to power training and evaluation of foundational voice models.
one_liner: Voice data that makes machines sound human

name: Cyberdesk
long_description:
Cyberdesk is the computer use agent for developers to automate legacy desktop apps. 
For example, one of our customers is building an AI agent for hospital patient intake, and they’re using us to automate an entire team of people manually clicking and typing into a desktop app to book appointments. 

We launched mid July and we’ve closed 164k ARR. Our agent is already operating in production environments, creating appointments in electronic health record apps and processing files in legacy ERPs.

We’ve built the first computer use agent that memorizes tasks and repeats them quickly while still adapting to unexpected changes on the screen. A good analogy is to how humans use computers: once we get used to an app, we use it much faster, while still adapting to random popups and crashes. This new paradigm for computer use will be needed by every company automating human workflows on computers.

Mahmoud previously built robotic process automation solutions impacting 20K+ employees at a Fortune 100 company. He also built AI & ML solutions at Baylor College of Medicine Neuroscience & Texas Children's Hospital + co-published a paper at the Rice Networks Group. 

Alan is ex-NASA and previously dropped out to be the first founding engineer at a PearX startup. He later bootstrapped a consumer AI startup to 50k in ARR.

Cyberdesk is already automating tasks that have been typically handled by business process outsourcing teams (BPO) teams, and we're doing so for 20% of the price. The BPO market is a $300B market, which represents a $60B opportunity.

We’d love to talk with you for a demo!
https://cal.com/mahmoud-al-madi-klrs5s/30min
one_liner: The computer use agent for developers to automate legacy desktop apps

name: Keystone
long_description: Keystone is an AI engineer that joins your team and understands your product from codebase to production. It can triage tickets, fix bugs, and automatically resolve incidents, autonomously.
one_liner: Your team's AI software engineer

name: Sidekick
long_description:
Build Zapier-style automations in minutes using only a chat interface.

Teams in sales, marketing, and ops often turn to platforms like Zapier to automate their busywork. But these platforms are too complex and time-consuming for them. Sidekick replaces the steep learning curve with a simple chat interface, making powerful automation accessible to everyone.
one_liner: Lovable for automations

name: BootLoop
long_description: BootLoop is building the first AI agent to write and test firmware on real hardware. Existing AI coding assistants fail completely with embedded systems, but our agent ingests datasheets, schematics, and other design files to write firmware in your style and automatically test it on your hardware.
one_liner: Firmware in minutes, not months - rigorously tested on real hardware

name: Stellon Labs
long_description: Stellon Labs is an AI research lab that is building tiny frontier AI models that can run on edge devices like smartphones, wearables and embedded systems. Our first open source model, KittenTTS, is a super-tiny text-to-speech model, that got 8K Github stars and 45K model downloads within 2 weeks of launching.
one_liner: Building tiny frontier AI models that run on edge devices

name: Embedder
long_description: AI coding agent that can write and test firmware on real hardware
one_liner: Claude Code for Firmware

name: Nozomio
long_description:
Nozomio is a product lab building engineers for the age of AI.

As coding agents become ubiquitous, the real bottleneck shifts from “write code” to “know which code and docs to feed them.” Starting with the tool named Nia, the mission is to provide context enrichment through agentic research and indexing of any external codebase(-s) or documentation via MCP / API.

Nozomio started with Arlan's early frustration with the agentic coding ecosystem, especially around context and memory. After winning Product of the Day in February and raising pre-seed, Arlan moved to London and then to SF as a solo immigrant from Kazakhstan to build the future of software engineering. 

try nia at trynia .ai <3
one_liner: Engineers for AI era, starting with contextual layer for coding agents

name: Autosana
long_description:
24/7 AI QA engineer for mobile teams. Add our agent to your mobile app repository and that's it.

Turns natural language into E2E tests, eradicating manual testing and the need to write/maintain UX scripts. Seamlessly integrates into your CI, supports both iOS and Android, and is framework-agnostic (React Native, Flutter, Swift, etc).

Saving your team hours and catching bugs before users do.
one_liner: QA agent for mobile teams

name: Floot
long_description:
Floot lets non-coders & entrepreneurs build real web apps that actually work. We’re taking a new approach by building everything from the ground up for AI. Since June, 3000+ users have created over 4000 apps on Floot.

Existing AI app builders fall short of enabling non-coders to build real, serious apps. They often:
- Break down when building anything more than a prototype or toy app
- Have non-coders stuck with errors they don’t understand
- Require non-coders to handle multiple services designed for developers (e.g. for backend, database, hosting, etc)

The fundamental problem: these AI app builders just cobble together existing developer tools and slap AI on top, but these tools were designed for humans and not for AI.

The result? Non-coders get excited, start building, hit a wall, and then abandon their projects.

Floot is purpose-built for AI. Our secret sauce:
1) Instead of reusing a coding framework designed for humans, we created a specialized framework that dictates how AI should write code and how the code runs on our infrastructure. This allows us to enforce best practices, detect errors earlier, and give the best feedback to the AI. As a result, Floot can write better code and fix issues more effectively.
2) Floot has the entire tech stack built-in (backend, database, hosting, etc) so building and managing an app feels seamless, especially for non-coders. And because we control every layer of the stack, we can optimize each layer for AI-first coding.

Because of this, non-coders can get more done with less time and prompting. They can finally build serious apps that work, instead of getting stuck in frustrating error loops and then abandoning their projects.

We also built a highly scalable hosting system directly on AWS so Floot apps can handle real traffic and business demands. This means non-coders can build, deploy, and scale their apps on a single platform seamlessly.

Plus, Floot is really fun to use! Try building an app at floot.com
one_liner: The easiest and most powerful way to build apps with AI.

name: Idler
long_description:
We’re building the platform to produce reinforcement learning environments on-demand, at scale. 

If you are building intelligent systems in research, robotics, simulation, product development, or beyond and hate wrestling with complicated infrastructure, Idler is for you.
one_liner: Creating the next trillion RL environments.

name: SigmanticAI
former_names: BitForge (in process of incorporating as SigmanticAI Inc due to trademark)
long_description:
SigmanticAI is building an AI-native hardware development assistant that automates the entire RTL design flow, from natural language to synthesizable HDL and testbenches, inside a seamless VSCode fork. Powered by fine-tuned Verilog LLMs, reinforcement learning, and real compiler feedback, SigmanticAI iteratively refines code until it compiles and passes synthesis, no matter how complex the design. It’s like the Cursor for HDL design. 

In addition to code generation, SigmanticAI can generate token-level annotations and onboarding documents to accelerate ramp-up for new engineers. With support for both cloud and on-prem deployment, it integrates with existing EDA tools to dramatically reduce debug time, improve collaboration, and accelerate hardware design across teams
one_liner: Suite of AI Agents and Tools to Accelerate HDL Design

name: Hera
long_description:
Hera is an AI motion designer that turns 5-hour projects into 5-minute tasks. 

When you're a YouTuber making an infographic animation, instead of spending hours manually clicking buttons in Adobe After Effects, you can create the same animation in minutes in Hera. 

Through talking to our users, we realized that 95% of time spent on motion graphics is manual button clicking, not creative work. This insight led us to focus on automating the tedious parts while giving the user all creative control.

We launched in May 2025, got 100k waitlist signups in 8 weeks, and we're doubling revenue monthly.
one_liner: AI Motion Designer

name: Vibe Code Go
long_description:
Vibe Code Go is a mobile app for software engineers. Now you can vibe code on the go.

90% of code (or more) is going to be written by AI by the end of the year. At the same time, I can order a hamburger from my phone, or I can file an expense report, but I can't code from my phone.

We think that with the advent of agentic coding, it's time for that to change.
one_liner: Code from your phone

name: stagewise
long_description:
stagewise builds a frontend coding agent for real codebases. We enable developers, designers and product managers to build and iterate on web apps with any tech stack in a simple and visually guided manner.

stagewise lives right inside your browser, makes changes in your local codebase and is compatible with all kinds of frameworks and setups - allowing it to be retrofitted into any existing project. Our agent enables you to show and tell what you want to change - all while using your app on localhost and without having to switch to external tools. Making changes is as easy as selecting elements, giving a simple prompt like “make it green and put it in the top right corner”, and immediately seeing the result.

We're two founders from Germany who met while working at a B2B SaaS startup. With backgrounds in both enterprise engineering (Rheinmetall, dSPACE) and building web apps used by thousands, we have the unique blend of discipline and product sense needed to build this.

After making our initial launch with the open-sourced toolbar that puts your favorite coding agent right inside your browser and going viral with it, we’re now launching a high-speed coding agent dedicated to frontend development - taking our product and the experience of our users to the next level.

Our vision is to empower anyone to create well-designed applications, regardless of their technical skill. We start with developers who lack design experience, but our ultimate goal is to change how products are built. stagewise will enable non-technical stakeholders - product managers, designers, and marketers - to directly iterate on the UI themselves, creating a new, collaborative workflow and making us the essential tool for building on the web.
one_liner: Frontend coding agent for real codebases

name: Anytrace
long_description:
Anytrace is the first AI agent that automates the end-to-end workflow of a support engineer. Our agent resolves technical support tickets by interacting with customers, investigating root causes, and tracking issues to completion.

Sam (CEO) was previously the co-founder and CEO of a DevOps platform that raised $2M. Taira (CTO) was the youngest SDE 2 at AWS Sagemaker Inference. We have over five years of experience handling technical support for customers ranging from small startups to Fortune 500 companies like Salesforce.

We came into YC with just an idea, and we already have our first pilot customer paying $5 per support ticket.

Essentially every B2B software company devotes engineering time to support, and our goal is to automate this away.
one_liner: The AI support engineering agent

name: Interfere
one_liner: Next-gen observability that finds & fixes bugs automatically
